Name: OpenMW Player
Author: Kezyma
Description: OpenMW Player automatically exports your mod list, enabled plugins, and grass mods to OpenMW whenever you run the game through Mod Organizer.

ReleaseNotes: (0.0.5) Initial release.
(0.0.6) Added automatic Bsa export.
(0.0.7) Added omwaddon and omwscripts support.
(0.0.8) Added headers to dummy esp so MO doesn't complain about it.
(0.0.9) Fixed a bug preventing dummy esp creation on mod installation.
(0.0.10) If enabled, dummy plugins will be created on MO startup and on enable/disable of any mod.
(0.0.11) Triggers an MO refresh when dummy plugins are created or deleted.
(0.0.13) Added Bsa selection menu to OpenMW Player.
(0.0.13) Added optional openmw.cfg full settings editor to OpenMW Player.
(0.0.13) Moved OpenMW Player settings to be stored in the profile, so they are duplicated if a profile is copied.
(0.0.13) Added the ability to import current openmw.cfg settings to Mod Organiser.
(0.0.14) Fixed an issue with MO 2.5 support.
(0.1.0) Added the ability to sort BSA files.
(0.1.0) Added the ability to import, export and manage OpenMW's settings.cfg.
(0.1.0) Added a manual export tool to the menu, for those who wanted it.
(0.1.1) Fixed an issue causing OpenMW to fail when exporting settings.cfg
(0.1.1) Fixed an issue where Bsa files wouldn't sort correctly.
(0.1.1) Added import of default settings so all options are available in OpenMW Player.
(0.1.2) Added a manual import tool to the menu, for those who want it.
(1.0.0) Running OpenMW executables through Mod Organizer now backs up and restores the original configuration when the application closes.
(1.0.0) Running OpenMW.exe through Mod Organizer now supports profile-specific saves.
(1.0.0) Each profile has their own openmw.cfg and settings.cfg which can be edited directly from the profile folder.
(1.0.0) Changes made while running OpenMW.exe or OpenMW-launcher.exe are now copied back to the profile in Mod Organizer without an import.
(1.0.1) OpenMW Player will no longer constantly prompt the user to select an OpenMW.cfg if they don't have one in the default location.
(1.0.1) If no default openmw.cfg is found in the default location, OpenMW Player will simply do nothing until the menu is opened to select a config.
(1.0.2) Fixed an issue with Qt6 and searching for the documents path.
(2.0.1) Updated to work with MO2 2.5.2.
(2.1.0) Groundcover plugins can now be sorted by load order or alphabetically. They can also be filtered with a text search.
(2.1.0) The openmw.cfg and settings.cfg can now be opened in an editor through the OpenMW Player tool, allowing quick manual edits.
(2.1.0) When OpenMW Player is installed, installing mods with omwaddon or omwscripts files will no longer warn the user that the mod looks incorrect.

(2.1.0) Help text describing each setting in settings.cfg is now displayed in the OpenMW Player tool, to make it more obvious what each setting does (taken from the OpenMW default settings.cfg comments).
(2.1.0) The settings.cfg editor panel resetting to the first tab on every edit has been fixed.
(2.1.0) The groundcover tab not allowing esm files to be selected has been fixed.
(2.1.0) Fixed a bug where settings with a blank default would not save when updated in OpenMW Player.
